TITLE: Implementing Styled Checkbox with Description DESCRIPTION: Example of a fully styled checkbox component with label and description text following VS Code's design patterns. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ```
setCachedStateField("terminalPowershellCounter", e.target.checked)} data-testid="terminal-powershell-counter-checkbox"> {t("settings:terminal.powershellCounter.label")}
{t("settings:terminal.powershellCounter.description")}
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing All Dependencies for Roo Code Using npm Shell DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install all necessary dependencies for the Roo Code project using npm. It assumes Node.js and npm are already installed. Running this command prepares the environment by downloading and configuring all required modules/packages needed to build and run the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/vi/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies using npm DESCRIPTION: This command installs all the necessary dependencies for the Roo Code project using npm. It prepares the project for running and development. Node.js and npm must be installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/hi/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies using npm DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install all the necessary dependencies for the Roo Code project using the `npm run install:all` command. This command will read the project's `package.json` file and install all listed dependencies, ensuring the development environment is properly configured. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/ca/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Roo Code DESCRIPTION: Command to install all dependencies for the Roo Code project. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multi-Point Strategy Sequence Diagram in Mermaid DESCRIPTION: Mermaid sequence diagram illustrating the process flow of the MultiPointStrategy implementation, showing interactions between Client Code, AwsBedrockHandler, MultiPointStrategy, and Amazon Bedrock Service. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/bedrock-cache-strategy-documentation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` sequenceDiagram participant Client as Client Code participant Bedrock as AwsBedrockHandler participant Strategy as MultiPointStrategy participant AWS as Amazon Bedrock Service Client->>Bedrock: createMessage(systemPrompt, messages) Note over Bedrock: Generate conversationId to track cache points Bedrock->>Bedrock: getModel() to get model info Bedrock->>Bedrock: Check if model supports prompt cache Bedrock->>Strategy: new MultiPointStrategy(config) Note over Strategy: config contains modelInfo, systemPrompt, messages, usePromptCache, previousCachePointPlacements Bedrock->>Strategy: determineOptimalCachePoints() alt usePromptCache is false or no messages Strategy->>Strategy: formatWithoutCachePoints() else Strategy->>Strategy: Check if system cache is supported alt supportsSystemCache and systemPrompt exists Strategy->>Strategy: meetsMinTokenThreshold(systemTokenCount) alt systemTokenCount >= minTokensPerCachePoint Strategy->>Strategy: Add cache point after system prompt Note over Strategy: Decrement remainingCachePoints end end Strategy->>Strategy: determineMessageCachePoints(minTokensPerPoint, remainingCachePoints) alt previousCachePointPlacements exists Note over Strategy: Analyze previous placements Note over Strategy: Preserve N-1 cache points when possible Note over Strategy: Determine which points to keep or combine else loop while currentIndex < messages.length and remainingCachePoints > 0 Strategy->>Strategy: findOptimalPlacementForRange(currentIndex, totalMessages-1, minTokensPerPoint) alt placement found Strategy->>Strategy: Add placement to placements array Strategy->>Strategy: Update currentIndex and decrement remainingCachePoints end end end Strategy->>Strategy: applyCachePoints(messages, placements) Strategy->>Strategy: Store cache point placements in result end Strategy-->>Bedrock: Return CacheResult with system blocks, messages, and messageCachePointPlacements Bedrock->>Bedrock: Store cache point placements for conversationId Bedrock->>AWS: Send request with multiple cache points AWS-->>Bedrock: Stream response Bedrock-->>Client: Yield response chunks ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Dependencies with npm DESCRIPTION: Installs all the required dependencies for the project using npm. This step is necessary to set up the development environment and run the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/ja/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning Roo Code Repository DESCRIPTION: This command clones the Roo Code repository from GitHub to the local machine. It uses `git clone` followed by the repository URL to create a local copy of the project. This is a prerequisite for any local development or contribution. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/es/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/RooVetGit/Roo-Code.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Schema for New Setting (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Adds the new setting to the globalSettingsSchema and globalSettingsRecord in schemas/index.ts. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` // In schemas/index.ts export const globalSettingsSchema = z.object({ // Existing settings... commandRiskLevel: z.enum(["readOnly", "reversibleChanges", "complexChanges"]).optional(), }) const globalSettingsRecord: GlobalSettingsRecord = { // Existing settings... commandRiskLevel: undefined, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning Roo Code Repository - Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell command clones the Roo Code project repository from Github using Git. It requires Git to be installed on the user's system. The command retrieves the latest complete source code for local development and contribution preparation. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/hi/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/RooVetGit/Roo-Code.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning the Roo Code Repository - Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell command clones the official Roo Code repository from GitHub to your local machine. It requires Git to be installed and internet access. The command downloads all project files into a new directory named 'Roo-Code'. No parameters required; outputs a new folder with the complete source code. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/it/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/RooVetGit/Roo-Code.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Visualizing Model Identification Flow with Mermaid DESCRIPTION: This sequence diagram illustrates the flow of model identification in the Amazon Bedrock provider implementation. It shows the interactions between various functions like parseArn, parseBaseModelId, getModelById, and getModel to determine the costModelConfig property. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` sequenceDiagram participant Constructor participant parseArn participant parseBaseModelId participant getModelById participant getModel Constructor->>parseArn: Initialize (if awsCustomArn provided) parseArn->>parseBaseModelId: Extract region prefix from modelId parseBaseModelId-->>parseArn: Return modelId without prefix parseArn->>parseArn: Determine if cross-region inference parseArn-->>Constructor: Return arnInfo with modelId and crossRegionInference flag Constructor->>getModel: Call getModel() getModel->>getModelById: Lookup model getModelById-->>getModel: Return model info getModel-->>Constructor: Return model config Constructor->>Constructor: Set this.costModelConfig ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Cloning Roo Code Repository DESCRIPTION: This command clones the Roo Code repository from GitHub, allowing contributors to access and modify the project's source code. It's a necessary first step for making changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/pl/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/RooVetGit/Roo-Code.git ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing AwsBedrockHandler with Standard Model Selection in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to initialize an AwsBedrockHandler with a standard model selection. It specifies the API model ID, AWS credentials, and region. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const handler = new AwsBedrockHandler({ apiModelId: "anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", awsAccessKey: "ACCESS_KEY", awsSecretKey: "SECRET_KEY", awsRegion: "us-east-1", }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Setting Persistence in WebView DESCRIPTION: Example of sending setting values from the webview to the extension for persistence. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` vscode.postMessage({ type: "multisearchDiffEnabled", bool: multisearchDiffEnabled }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Loading New Setting State in ClineProvider (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Adds the new setting to the getState method in ClineProvider to load it from storage. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` return { // existing settings... newSetting: stateValues.newSetting ?? false, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing New Setting in resolveWebviewView (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Adds the new setting to the initialization in the resolveWebviewView method of ClineProvider. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` this.getState().then( ({ // existing settings... newSetting, }) => { // Initialize the setting with its stored value or default FeatureClass.setNewSetting(newSetting ?? false) }, ) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Webview (Vite/React with HMR) - Shell DESCRIPTION: This shell command runs the development server for Roo Code's webview, based on Vite and React with Hot Module Replacement (HMR). Requires prior installation of dependencies. Run this command in the project root to enable live-reloading UI development. Outputs a running development server accessible via specified port. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/it/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Vite/React Web App for Development DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to start the Vite/React web application with Hot Module Replacement (HMR) using the `npm run dev` command. This command initiates the development server, allowing developers to see changes in real-time as they modify the web app's code. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/ca/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Roo Code Webview Development Server with Vite/React Using npm Shell DESCRIPTION: This snippet runs the development server for the Roo Code webview application, built with Vite and React, with Hot Module Replacement enabled. Executing this command allows developers to work on the frontend interface with real-time updates and debugging capabilities during development. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/vi/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Roo Code Web View Using NPM Development Server Command DESCRIPTION: This command runs the `dev` script defined in the project's package.json, which typically starts the Vite/React development server with Hot Module Replacement (HMR) enabled. It allows instant preview and live updates of the web view during development. Required dependencies must be installed beforehand. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/fr/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Webview Development Server DESCRIPTION: This command starts the webview development server using Vite/React, enabling HMR (Hot Module Replacement). This facilitates rapid development and testing of the webview component. Requires npm and appropriate project configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/hi/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Checkbox State Updates in VSCode Extension DESCRIPTION: Implementation of state update logic for checkbox settings in the ClineProvider class. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` case "multisearchDiffEnabled": await this.updateGlobalState("multisearchDiffEnabled", message.bool) await this.postStateToWebview() break ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Webview for Development - NPM DESCRIPTION: This command starts the webview (Vite/React app) with Hot Module Replacement (HMR) using npm, allowing for rapid development and testing of the user interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/it/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Roo Code Webview DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Vite/React app with Hot Module Replacement for Roo Code's webview. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing AwsBedrockHandler with Custom ARN for Prompt Router in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to initialize an AwsBedrockHandler with a custom ARN for a prompt router. It specifies the API model ID, AWS credentials, region, and a custom ARN for the prompt router. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const handler = new AwsBedrockHandler({ apiModelId: "anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", awsAccessKey: "ACCESS_KEY", awsSecretKey: "SECRET_KEY", awsRegion: "us-west-2", awsCustomArn: "arn:aws:bedrock:us-west-2:123456789012:prompt-router/my-router", }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Development Webview Server (Shell) DESCRIPTION: This command starts the development server for the Roo Code webview component, which is likely a Vite/React application. It enables Hot Module Replacement (HMR) for immediate feedback on frontend changes. This command should be run from the root of the cloned repository after installing dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Roo Code Extension Dependency in package.json DESCRIPTION: This JSON snippet shows how to add the Roo Code extension as a dependency in the package.json file of another extension. This ensures that the Roo Code extension is activated before the dependent extension. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/src/exports/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` "extensionDependencies": ["rooveterinaryinc.roo-cline"] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing AwsBedrockHandler with Custom ARN for Foundation Model in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to initialize an AwsBedrockHandler with a custom ARN for a foundation model. It includes the API model ID, AWS credentials, region, and a custom ARN. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const handler = new AwsBedrockHandler({ apiModelId: "anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", awsAccessKey: "ACCESS_KEY", awsSecretKey: "SECRET_KEY", awsRegion: "us-east-1", awsCustomArn: "arn:aws:bedrock:us-east-1::foundation-model/anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing and Using Roo Code API in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to access the Roo Code API and use its various methods, including starting new tasks, sending messages, and simulating button presses in the chat interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/src/exports/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const extension = vscode.extensions.getExtension("rooveterinaryinc.roo-cline") if (!extension?.isActive) { throw new Error("Extension is not activated") } const api = extension.exports if (!api) { throw new Error("API is not available") } // Start a new task with an initial message. await api.startNewTask("Hello, Roo Code API! Let's make a new project...") // Start a new task with an initial message and images. await api.startNewTask("Use this design language", ["data:image/webp;base64,..."]) // Send a message to the current task. await api.sendMessage("Can you fix the @problems?") // Simulate pressing the primary button in the chat interface (e.g. 'Save' or 'Proceed While Running'). await api.pressPrimaryButton() // Simulate pressing the secondary button in the chat interface (e.g. 'Reject'). await api.pressSecondaryButton() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Test Suite Structure DESCRIPTION: Example of how to structure a new test suite using Mocha's TDD interface SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/e2e/VSCODE_INTEGRATION_TESTS.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import * as assert from "assert" import * as vscode from "vscode" suite("Your Test Suite Name", () => { test("Should do something specific", async function () { // Your test code here }) }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting the Roo Code development webview with Vite and React - Shell DESCRIPTION: This npm script initiates the development webview of Roo Code using the Vite development server with React integration and Hot Module Replacement (HMR). Developers can use this command to launch the local version of the web interface for rapid development and real-time updates. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/pt-BR/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Roo Code Webview Development Server - Shell DESCRIPTION: This npm command launches the Roo Code webview with Hot Module Replacement enabled using Vite and React. It allows developers to see live updates in the webview interface as they modify source code. Requires prior installation of all dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/hi/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Webview Development DESCRIPTION: Starts the webview development environment using Vite and React. This allows for hot module replacement (HMR), providing a faster development experience. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/ja/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Webview (Vite/React App) (npm) DESCRIPTION: This command starts the webview application using Vite, a fast build tool for modern web development, and React, a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It enables Hot Module Replacement (HMR) for rapid development and immediate feedback on code changes within the web interface. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/ja/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run dev ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initial Cache Point Configuration and Placement DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates initial configuration setup and cache point placement for a new conversation with four messages. Shows how the algorithm evaluates token counts and places cache points based on minimum thresholds. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/bedrock-cache-strategy-documentation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const config = { modelInfo: { maxTokens: 4096, contextWindow: 200000, supportsPromptCache: true, maxCachePoints: 3, minTokensPerCachePoint: 100, cachableFields: ["system", "messages"], }, systemPrompt: "You are a helpful assistant.", messages: [ { role: "user", content: "Tell me about machine learning." }, { role: "assistant", content: "Machine learning is a field of study..." }, { role: "user", content: "What about deep learning?" }, { role: "assistant", content: "Deep learning is a subset of machine learning..." }, ], usePromptCache: true, } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Checkbox Setting Type Definition in TypeScript DESCRIPTION: Defines the interface for checkbox settings in the ExtensionStateContext, including the setting value and its setter function. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` interface ExtensionStateContextType { multisearchDiffEnabled: boolean setMultisearchDiffEnabled: (value: boolean) => void } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Async Operation Handling DESCRIPTION: Example of handling timeouts and intervals for async operations SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/e2e/VSCODE_INTEGRATION_TESTS.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` let startTime = Date.now() while (Date.now() - startTime < timeout) { if (condition) { break } await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, interval)) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing AWS Bedrock Handler with Cross-Region ARN DESCRIPTION: Example showing initialization of AwsBedrockHandler with a cross-region ARN using us-west-2 region and US region prefix. Demonstrates how the handler processes region prefixes and configures cross-region inference. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const handler = new AwsBedrockHandler({ apiModelId: "anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", awsAccessKey: "ACCESS_KEY", awsSecretKey: "SECRET_KEY", awsRegion: "us-east-1", awsCustomArn: "arn:aws:bedrock:us-west-2:123456789012:inference-profile/us.anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0" }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing New Setting in ExtensionStateContextProvider (TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: Adds the new setting to the initial state in the useState call within the ExtensionStateContextProvider component. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/settings.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` const [state, setState] = useState({ // existing settings... newSetting: false, // Default value for the new setting }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Single-Region Cost Model Configuration DESCRIPTION: Shows the resulting cost model configuration for a single-region ARN setup, including the complete ARN and model specifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/model-identification.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` { id: "arn:aws:bedrock:ap-northeast-3:123456789012:inference-profile/apne3.anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0", info: { maxTokens: 4096, contextWindow: 128000, inputPrice: 3, outputPrice: 15 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Database Migration Script DESCRIPTION: This command generates a new migration script based on changes made to the schema.ts file. It uses a custom npm script to invoke Drizzle ORM's migration generation functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/evals/packages/db/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` pnpm db:generate ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Class Relationship Diagram in Mermaid DESCRIPTION: Mermaid diagram showing the relationships between key classes in the cache strategy implementation, including CacheStrategy, MultiPointStrategy, AwsBedrockHandler, and related configuration classes. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/cline_docs/bedrock/bedrock-cache-strategy-documentation.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: mermaid CODE: ``` classDiagram class CacheStrategy { <> #config: CacheStrategyConfig #systemTokenCount: number +determineOptimalCachePoints(): CacheResult #initializeMessageGroups(): void #calculateSystemTokens(): void #createCachePoint(): ContentBlock #messagesToContentBlocks(messages): Message[] #meetsMinTokenThreshold(tokenCount): boolean #estimateTokenCount(message): number #applyCachePoints(messages, placements): Message[] #formatResult(systemBlocks, messages): CacheResult } class MultiPointStrategy { +determineOptimalCachePoints(): CacheResult -determineMessageCachePoints(minTokensPerPoint, remainingCachePoints): CachePointPlacement[] -formatWithoutCachePoints(): CacheResult -findOptimalPlacementForRange(startIndex, endIndex, minTokensPerPoint): CachePointPlacement } class AwsBedrockHandler { -client: BedrockRuntimeClient -costModelConfig: object -previousCachePointPlacements: Map +createMessage(systemPrompt, messages): ApiStream +completePrompt(prompt): Promise -supportsAwsPromptCache(modelConfig): boolean -getModelByName(modelName): object +getModel(): object -removeCachePoints(content): any -convertToBedrockConverseMessages(anthropicMessages, systemMessage, usePromptCache, modelInfo, conversationId): object } class CacheStrategyConfig { +modelInfo: ModelInfo +systemPrompt?: string +messages: MessageParam[] +usePromptCache: boolean +previousCachePointPlacements?: CachePointPlacement[] } class ModelInfo { +maxTokens: number +contextWindow: number +supportsPromptCache: boolean +maxCachePoints: number +minTokensPerCachePoint: number +cachableFields: Array } class CacheResult { +system: SystemContentBlock[] +messages: Message[] +messageCachePointPlacements?: CachePointPlacement[] } class CachePointPlacement { +index: number +type: string +tokensCovered: number } CacheStrategy <|-- MultiPointStrategy : extends CacheStrategy o-- CacheStrategyConfig : uses CacheStrategyConfig o-- ModelInfo : contains CacheStrategy ..> CacheResult : produces CacheStrategy ..> CachePointPlacement : creates AwsBedrockHandler ..> MultiPointStrategy : creates AwsBedrockHandler ..> CachePointPlacement : tracks MultiPointStrategy ..> CachePointPlacement : preserves ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Storybook Welcome Page with Meta Component in JSX DESCRIPTION: This snippet uses the Meta component to set the title of the Storybook page to "Welcome". It also includes a heading and a brief description of the Roo Code storybook's purpose. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/webview-ui/src/stories/Welcome.mdx#2025-04-23_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: JSX CODE: ``` # Welcome This Roo Code storybook is used to independently develop components for the Roo Code webview UI. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies using npm (Shell) DESCRIPTION: This command installs all necessary dependencies for the Roo Code project, likely including both frontend (webview) and backend (extension) dependencies as defined in package.json files within the monorepo structure. It requires Node.js and npm to be installed and should be run from the root directory of the cloned repository. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` npm run install:all ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Roo Code VSIX Extension Locally using Code CLI in Shell DESCRIPTION: Installs the Roo Code VS Code extension from a locally built VSIX file using the VS Code command-line interface. The placeholder must be replaced with the actual built version number. Prior build of the VSIX file is required. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/pt-BR/README.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` code --install-extension bin/roo-cline-.vsix ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Roo Code extension into a .vsix package - Shell DESCRIPTION: This npm script builds the Roo Code project into a distributable Visual Studio Code extension package with a .vsix file. The generated package is output to the "bin/" directory and can later be installed directly into VSCode for testing or deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/roovetgit/roo-code/blob/main/locales/pt-BR/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing VSCode Extension from VSIX DESCRIPTION: This command installs the VSCode extension from a .vsix file. This is used after building the extension to install it locally in VSCode. Requires the VSCode CLI tool 'code'.
